trans-unit.source: Defines a 5 x 5 matrix that contains the coordinates for the RGBAW space.
Several methods of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageAttributes"></xref> class adjust image colors by using a color matrix.
This class cannot be inherited.
The matrix coefficients constitute a 5 x 5 linear transformation that is used for transforming ARGB homogeneous values.
For example, an ARGB vector is represented as red, green, blue, alpha and w, where w is always 1.
For example, suppose you want to start with the color (0.2, 0.0, 0.4, 1.0) and apply the following transformations:
Double the red component
Add 0.2 to the red, green, and blue components
The following matrix multiplication will perform the pair of transformations in the order listed.
![Recoloring](~/add/media/recoloring01.gif "Recoloring")
The elements of a color matrix are indexed (zero-based) by row and then column.
For example, the entry in the fifth row and third column of matrix M is denoted by M[4][2].
The 5Ã—5 identity matrix (shown in the following illustration) has 1s on the diagonal and 0s everywhere else.
If you multiply a color vector by the identity matrix, the color vector does not change.
A convenient way to form the matrix of a color transformation is to start with the identity matrix and make a small change that produces the desired transformation.
![Recoloring](~/add/media/recoloring02.gif "Recoloring")
For a more detailed discussion of matrices and transformations, see .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorMatrix"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the class using the elements in the specified matrix newColorMatrix.
The values of the elements for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorMatrix"></xref>.
Gets or sets the element at the specified row and column in the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorMatrix"></xref>.
The row of the element.
The column of the element.
The element at the specified row and column.
